cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across the northwest Caribbean, expected to cross the northeast Yucatán tonight, re-emerge over the southern Gulf Wednesday, then turn north-northwest and north toward the central-to-western Louisiana coast late Thursday into Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central/south-central Louisiana coast (west of Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Texas to the western Florida Panhandle, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (with a 47 % chance) are possible Friday; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge above 3 ft is likely along southeast Louisiana, including Plaquemines Parish, especially with Friday’s high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast totals of 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts could produce flash and river flooding in Plaquemines Parish Friday-Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands Friday; dangerous seas and river currents impacting vessel operations beginning late Thursday.
